comments:
After some time editing (M9, Win2003, Term.svcs) the whole Eclipse
gets into state when whenever I type Ctrl-C, it throws some
exception (that I see in the log) and opens a dialog saying
"An SWT has occurred. You are recommended to exit the workbench."
and some more text ending with "Do you want to exit the workbench?"

If I don't exit, it continues OK and copies the block.

If I typed Ctrl-X, the same behavior happens, only the text doesn't
get deleted.


here is the entry from log:

Created an attachment (id=10988)
The log file

Attached is the .log file.
There are some other SWT exceptions that may or may not be related to the
problem.

Additional experiments show that this is MOST PROBABLY related to Terminal
Services (Remote desktop) sessions (or connections, not 100% sure).
Running on server's console works OK. If I start a remote desktop (even while
having Eclipse running) to the same server I start seeing these SWT errors.
If I close all remote desktops to the server, the (still running) Eclipse
starts behaving just fine.

Since I depend on Remote Desktops (former Terminal Services), this is a serious
issue for me. There must be some clipboard issue on windows with several
connections/sessions but I don't know what is is.

Changing to JDT since this seems to be happening only in Java sources.
(Couldn't get it to fail in TXT file)

Latest observation:
It happens only in Java files with folding turned on.
